title.value: Joint Machine-Transporter Scheduling for Multistage Jobs with Adjustable Computation Time
title.justification: This is the exact title of the paper as provided by the user.
title.quote: Joint Machine-Transporter Scheduling for Multistage Jobs with Adjustable Computation Time

extractions.description: This paper presents a scalable solution with adjustable computation time for the joint problem of scheduling and assigning machines and transporters for missions that must be completed in a fixed order of operations across multiple stages. The work aims to minimize both the required time and energy consumed by the transporters, using an integer linear programming solver within a sliding time window.

type.justification: The paper presents a practical implementation and simulation results of their proposed algorithm in a real-world scenario related to water sampling.
type.quote: This section shows simulation results on 15 randomly generated experiments with 100 jobs, 10 drones, and 10 laboratories.

name.justification: The paper details an optimization algorithm which is a sub-field of machine learning, often employing techniques from operations research and combinatorial optimization.
name.quote: This paper presents a scalable solution with adjustable computation time for the joint problem of scheduling and assigning machines and transporters for missions that must be completed in a fixed order of operations across multiple stages.

name.justification: The problem of scheduling and assigning machines and transporters for fixed operations is a classic example of a combinatorial optimization problem.
name.quote: This problem is a variation of the flexible flow shop with transports, that is proven to be NP-complete.

name.justification: The experiments simulate a real-world water sampling project along the coast of Nova Scotia.
name.quote: As an experiment, the proposed method is implemented in an automated system for water sampling along the coast of Nova Scotia using a swarm of flying robots that could be considered one of the current large-scale water sampling programs in which shellfish production is regulated by the Canadian Shellfish Sanitation Program (CSSP) and requires determination of water sanitation levels on shellfish beds by monitoring the presence of E. Coli.

name.justification: The Dijkstar library is used for finding the shortest path in the graph representing the job scheduling problem.
name.quote: An implementation of Dijkstra’s single source shortest paths algorithm1 is used to find the shortest path... 1 https://pypi.org/project/Dijkstar/

name.justification: The paper explicitly mentions the use of Google OR-Tools for solving the optimization problem.
name.quote: Google’s OR-Tools2 is selected as the solver, and the candidate value is added as an integer variable to the solver that can take only 0 or 1 for each candidate schedule. 2 https://developers.google.com/optimization
